name: Susan Collins
summary: Moderate Republican Senator from Maine who voted to convict Trump in his first impeachment trial and wrote in Nikki Haley rather than vote for Trump in 2024.

keyStatements.quote: The president did, in fact, pressure a foreign government to help him in his reelection. His personal interest in the investigation of a political rival was inseparable from any legitimate foreign policy objective.
keyStatements.context: Explaining her vote in first impeachment (voted to acquit but condemned conduct)

keyStatements.quote: January 6th was a terrible, terrible day for our country. And there is no doubt in my mind that the president's actions and his words prior to that day were a contributing factor in what happened.

timeline.event: Did not endorse Trump for president
Voted to acquit in first impeachment
Voted to convict Trump in second impeachment
timeline.significance: One of seven Republicans to vote for conviction

timeline.event: Wrote in Nikki Haley for president

credibility.background: Long-serving moderate Republican Senator, known for independent voting record and bipartisan work

oppositionReasons: Trump pressured foreign government for personal political gain
Trump's actions contributed to January 6 attack
Trump's conduct is unbecoming of the office
Trump prioritizes personal interest over national interest
endorsement: Wrote in Nikki Haley in 2024 instead of voting for Trump
